channel.title: Labs on BIO 108 and 217
channel.description: Recent content in Labs on BIO 108 and 217

item.title: May 10 Lab
item.description: The three students enrolled in BIO 217 have class on May 10 and have decided to go on a trip. Students in BIO 108 do not have class and instead have Snow/Study Day. However, 108 students are welcome to join the trip; ideally, let me know if you’re coming. Plan We’ll go to Alley Pond Park in Queens. We’ll park at the parking lot with access from Wincester Blvd. (What3Words location error.

item.title: May 3 Lab
item.description: Plan We’re planning to go to Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge (eBird hotspot) for an extended trip, leaving at 8 from the regular place and returning about 12:30. See the illustrated checklist for an idea about what’s possible there for the first week of May. Songbirds are towards the bottom of that list. It should be awesome. We will park at and start from the Visitor’s Center, where we may need to fill out permits for you if it is open.

item.title: Apr 26 Lab
item.description: Plan The van is back for real (they say!), and the birds are at Hempstead Lake SP (hotspot - South End, illustrated histogram. Target species: Swallows (Barn, Bank, Tree, and keeping an eye out for Northern Rough-winged and Cliff) and Chimney Swift from last week’s learning group, Sparrows we haven’t observed (Savannah, Swamp, Eastern Towhee), and especially a large number of arriving songbirds at the front-end of their frequency pulse (warblers, vireos, orioles, Indigo Bunting, etc.

item.title: Apr 19 Lab
item.description: Plan We were heading to Valley Stream SP, but there wasn’t a van, so we walked around campus. Expected conditions nice Jobs I did the recording. eBird list On campus: Hofstra University
